item.description:
Phil Ochs died when he was thirty-six, but he influenced many of the well-known activist Ochs preferred "topical") singers of the 1960's and 1970's, whose contemporary he was.  Part of the Greenwich folk music scene in the early 1960's, he appeared at Carnegie Hall and was part of many protest concerts throughout the country and the world.  This "biographical documentary examines Ochs' troubled life and the 1960s protest movement; it features Pete Seeger, Joan Baez, Tom Hayden, Judy Henske, Billy Bragg, Ed Sanders, Christopher Hitchens and Sean Penn," from the RAW website.  On Friday night, Phil Ochs' sister Sonny, whose website contains information about her brother ( http://www.sonnyochs.com/philbio.html ), will discuss the film and her brother with the audience.

 

NOTE:  As of this posting, the time for the film is not set.  I expect it to be 7:30pm and will update once RAW updates their website.

 

http://www.realartways.org/cinema.htm#phil-ochs

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: "Phil Ochs: There But for Fortune" @ Real Art Ways
